intro: Logania diffusa, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces a milky sap that can be toxic. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
